About This Game


Match tokens to unlock incredible riches in The Treasures of Montezuma 3! With Casual and Timed modes to enjoy, 160 levels to beat, and dozens of mind-bending mini-puzzles to solve, you could be in the jungle for months!

  • Enjoy Casual and Timed modes!
  • Upgrade your power-ups between stages!
  • Unlock incredible riches!
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: XP/Vista/7/8
    • Processor: 1.6 GHz processor
    • Memory: 256 MB RAM
    • Graphics: DirectX compatible 128 MB
    • DirectX: Version 9.0
    • Hard Drive: 1 GB available space
READ MORE

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
Pi
388 products in account
53 reviews
Recommended
11.7 hrs on record
Posted: January 4
Good game. Five tombs. 8 chests each with four or five point objectives per chest. Play match 3 to cause the chests to open when you meet predefined point totals and collect all the medals from the chest. This part has a really nice balance to it. You're not guaranteed at any point to achieve the points and get a medal but neither is it so hard to achieve as to be frustrating.

There are in game achievements. A few of them lack balance. For example to get the bronze medal for destroying the tokens requires 100,000. I played the entire game thru once and only got to 66000 whereas "total points" across all chests has a gold level of 100 million which is achievable by end of 4th tomb on first play through. In other words to achieve gold on all achievements you'd have to play thru the game about 10 times because of the one archievement, whereas most of the others you'll have gold by one play thru. Beyond that nuissance the game is enjoyable.

Well worth a couple of bucks.

As a bonus the cards that drop tend to sell for about 25-30 cents a piece (at least they did when I bought the game).

Read More
